result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leron O Strawder

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leron O Strawder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Leron O Strawder.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense counsel moved to withdraw as counsel due to conflict.  Court granted motion.  Court vacated jury trial set for 11-14-2022.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (24 pages) commencing 06-14-22 by KATHERINE NELSON.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Leron O Strawder not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 8-30-2022 and all responses to be filed by 9-27-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Leron O Strawder not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the status as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leron O Strawder in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Defendant Leron O Strawder in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Shipman    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Date provided by Br. 40 clerk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Arial Rosenberg
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TNL, BLN, 9400 Block W Silver Spring Ave

Defendant Leron O Strawder in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Leron O Strawder in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leron O Strawder appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
